Statement: Greetings! I'm Demetrius, local scientist and father. Thanks for introducing yourself!
I'm studying the local plants and animals from my home laboratory.
Have you met my daughter Maru? She's interested to meet you.
Maru helps me out in the lab sometimes...
[Image happy]She's a great lab assistant.
[Image neutral]... and a good kid.
[Image sad]It's hard to do good science without Maru's help...
But her happiness is much more important than my experiment!
[Image neutral]...
If she wanted to come help though...
Well, I'd appreciate her help.
This valley has a very vibrant and diverse ecosystem. That's one reason I was excited to move here.
So much of it is still undeveloped that we're in a bit of a refuge for wild life.
We do have a vibrant and diverse ecosystem here, but it's missing a large top predator.
Just not enough space to support a population.
So humans do need to step in and fill some of that niche.
You're probably growing a lot of interesting plants on your farm, huh?
Maybe I'll stop by your place some day and check it out.
I hope you're maintaining a healthy soil with a variety of crops!
I can imagine it being pretty peaceful, working outdoors with plants all day.
How is the farming business going? It's parsnip season, isn't it?
How is the farming business going? It's parsnip season, isn't it?
Good to hear! I hope your parsnips do well this year!
I guess that's true.
I'm sure you'll get it.
Sorry to hear that!
Maybe you should look at getting some help.
Looking for a little more excitement I guess!
Well, the minerals out of there are useful for Maru's experiments.
So I guess it's good someone enjoy it!
I suppose fishing lets you relax a little more.
Robin has a hot temper. It's better to stay on her good side.
[Image happy]Don't tell her I said that.
Robin has a hot temper. It's better to stay on her good side.
[Image Unique]...now if I could only quantify her mood levels, perhaps I could model the fluctuations using a sinusoidal curve...
I don't know why Robin gets so mad all the time.
[Image Unique]...I create a hypothosis and try out a solution...
[Image Sad]Then when that ends in yet another...
Well, I just keep trying.

Conversations.Key: How long do ou keep trying
Statement: I just don't understand what I'm doing wrong.
It's not like she's always angry, don't get me wrong.
What? Oh, sorry, Robin and I got into another fight last night.
I thought my most recent hypothosis was working...
I just...
How long do you keep trying?
I love Robin, but I know she's unhappy too.
I don't want her to be unhappy.
The only hypothosis that I have now is that there is something about me that makes her unhappy.
Twenty years ago we thought we could make each other happy.
[Image sad]Should we be unhappy forever because of one mistake?
While I suppose that's true...
I can't create a set of rules based on that.
*sighs*
I want Robin to be happy, and I just don't know if I can do that.
Robin's a little further away every day.
I love rules, simple and straight forward to follow.
Right answers defined by experimentation.
I don't think that will let me find a way to make her happy.
Yes, Robin and I spend a lot of time unhappy.
Well, 5 percent happy, 10 percent fighting, 15 percent unhappy, 30 percent neutral, and 40 percent apart.
Only counting time awake... obviously...
Sorry, when things get stressful I go to what makes sense to me, statistical analysis.
I want Robin to be happy, I do...
I've been thinking about our late conversation.
Thanks for listening to me, by the way.
I want Robin to be happy, I want to be happy.
I've tried everything I can think of and none of the experiments have produced positive results.
Maybe it is time to declare the experiment of our marriage a failure.
[Image 2]You've never really cared for someone have you?
Well, anyone but yourself.
All relationships have trouble sometimes.
Let's see... If compounds in the rhizosphere contain sufficient levels of Carbon-13, then...[Image Unique]
Oh! Sorry. I was pondering some data and I didn't notice you there.
I'm really concentrating on this, maybe we can talk later?
It's good to take a break from work every now and then.
I guess that's kind of difficult when you live on a farm, though.
Hey, at least in the winter you don't have to worry about crops.
I have a really hard time taking a break from my work.
[Image happy]My work is every where here.
Thats why I love living here.
[Image sad]Though I think sometimes I get too caught up in it.
Hi [Farmer]! How are you doing today?
Hi [Farmer]! How are you doing today?
I wish I could make your farming job easier somehow.
Hopefully you're feeling productive though!
Most people don't like the rain.
But I can see the advantage for a farmer!
I think Sabastian likes the rain too...
[Speaker None]Demetrius is deep in thought.
Sorry, I'm really busy.
There's so many plants to study right now.
Make sure to water your plants every day.
Although, if you're using water retaining soil you don't need to worry about watering as often.
It's pretty convenient.
Make sure to water your plants every day.
Although, if you're using water retaining soil you don't need to worry about watering as often.
It's pretty convenient.
I guess you already know that though.
How's the farming business going? It's tomato season, isn't it?
I always get a wonderful sense of peace when I can work outside in nature.
So I heard Maru had you look through that telescope out back.
How did you like it?
Maru loves space, and the mountain air here is pretty good for making observations.
I wish I could build her a real observatory at up on the mountain tops.
You know, the amazing thing about space is that even the emptiest looking part of the sky is filled with uncountable galaxies as far as our best telescopes can see.
Seeing an empty void is more about your point of view than reality.
I can appreciate that, space isn't for everyone.
I much prefer plants to space, but Maru loves space, so you better know a thing or two if you want to be close to her.
If you and Maru become friends, I'm sure she'll show you how to use that telescope out back.
Pretty exciting, huh?
I enjoy Maru stopping by and using her telescope to keep up on her observations.
I'd really love to find funding for a real observatory in these mountains.
It's not a bad location for it as I understand it.
I enjoy Maru stopping by and using her telescope to keep up on her observations.
The clear, cold, dry air really improves the images you can get through the telescope.
[Image unique]Hmm... If strigolactone levels could be increased, would it have a proportional effect on mycorhizal growth?
Oh! Sorry. I was pondering some data and I didn't notice you there.
I'm a bit busy, maybe we can talk later?
I became a scientist because I wanted to contribute to the progression of our species.
[Image happy]Of course, civilization would fall apart without farmers like yourself.
You make today possible, I seek to make tomorrow better.
During this time of year I divert my attentions to fungi.
They're critical to many kinds of plants and its a great time to see them in action.
We know a lot about nature thanks to science.
But there's always a lot more to learn.
We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
I didn't come up with that, but I really like the quote.
I was thinking about the quote I told you last time we spoke, the island surrounded by the sea of ignorance...
The same can be said about this valley.
It seems every time I think I've seen everything it has to offer something new comes up and lets me know there is just so much more to learn.
[Image happy]I really need to stop thinking about the island surrounded by a sea of ignorance!
[Image neutral]It seems like this is true of our knowledge of the people around us as well.
How much do I really know about Maru, she's my child, and I know her big life goals...
[Image sad]At least I hope I do.
[Image neutral]I know she's very good at science and a great help in the lab, but who is she outside of science.
[Image sad]You'd think her father would know that, wouldn't you.
We know a lot about nature thanks to science.
But there's always a lot more to learn.
We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
I didn't come up with that, but I really like the quote.
How's the farming business going? It's corn season, isn't it?
I love being outside in the fall, the weather is great and the leave are beautiful.
I'm taking a break from my research right now.
I'm taking a break from my research right now.
Robin told me too...
But it's hard to think about anything other than my work some times.
Talk to my wife if you want to increase the size of your house.
She can take on most any job!
Robin mentioned you haven't added a kitchen to your house yet.
Do you eat at the saloon a lot or do you just enjoy raw food?
Do you eat at the saloon a lot or do you just enjoy raw food?
[Image unique]Umm... yeah I don't think thats true.
I do enjoy the occasional meal down there, but I can't imagine eating it everyday.
[Image happy]Ha! I guess that makes life cheaper.
Not sure about better though.
Umm... my specialty is plants, not nutrition
But we did evolve to eat cooked food, thats why our intestines are so short.
Everything in moderation is likely good.
If you really want to know I'd find some peer reviewed papers on the matter.
